intro: Sommera zygocalyx, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display.
